title: gccgo: 4.7.2 linux x86_64: unexpected fault address 0x0
body:
by **viriketo**: 
1. What is a short input program that triggers the error?

I don't have such a small program. Only a big program (open source), after a long run
processing lots of data. How could I supply enough information, without the big program?

I can provide gdb traces and so on.

2. What is the full compiler output?

The compiler works fine, but the code works with gc, fails with gccgo:
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xb code=0x1 addr=0x0]

goroutine 1 [chan receive]:
unexpected fault address 0x0
unexpected fault address tar: Final de l'arxiu inesperat

3. What version of the compiler are you using?  (Run it with the -V flag.)

I built with: go build -gccgoflags -O2
